ui
Class AbstractUI

java.lang.Object
  ui.AbstractUI
Direct Known Subclasses:
UI, UI
public abstract class AbstractUI
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for Simulator UI. Extended by UI implementations.

getArgList

protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArgList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args,
                                                             java.lang.String argSwitch,
                                                             boolean isRequired,
                                                             boolean isSwitchValueRequired,
                                                             boolean isSwitchValueListAllowed,
                                                             java.lang.String valueIfSwitchMissing)
                                                      throws AbstractUI.ArgException
Parse command-line arguments for specified switch, returning its value.

Parameters:
args - list of command-line arguments.
argSwitch - string (starting with "-" that starts argument.
isRequired - switch is required.
isSwitchValueRequired - true iff a value is required to follow switch if it is present.
isSwitchValueListAllowed - true iff a list of values is allowed to follow the switch.
valueIfSwitchMissing - value to return if switch is missing.
Returns:
list of values of argSwitch or "" if it is found, but with no value.
Throws:
AbstractUI.ArgException - if switch is not found, isRequired is true, and valueIfSwitchMissing is null or if it is found without a value and isSwitchValueRequired is true.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argsArray)
Main entry point to Simple Machine (usualled called by SimpleMachine.main() to give the execution instance the name "SimpleMachine" instead of "AbstractUI", but starting with this class works fine too).
